Now, let's create a section for tracking the repair history of your watches. Here's a suggested format:

**Watch Repair History**

**Watch 1: [Insert watch brand/model]**

* **Repair History:**
	+ **Repair Date:** [Insert date]
	+ **Repair Description:** New leather strap and battery replacement
	+ **Cost:** [Insert cost, if known]
	+ **Repair Shop/Person:** [Insert name of repair shop or person who performed the repair]
* **Future Repairs Needed:** [Insert any upcoming or recommended repairs, e.g., "cleaning and polishing", "water resistance test"]

You can add more watches as needed, and create a new section for each one. This way, you'll have a record of all the repairs and maintenance done on each watch, including the dates, costs, and details of the work performed.

For your watch that needs a new leather strap and battery replacement, you can fill in the repair history section like this:

**Watch 1: [Insert watch brand/model]**

* **Repair History:**
	+ **Repair Date:** [Insert date when the repair is scheduled or completed]
	+ **Repair Description:** New leather strap and battery replacement
	+ **Cost:** [Insert cost, if known]
	+ **Repair Shop/Person:** [Insert name of repair shop or person who will perform the repair]
* **Future Repairs Needed:** [Leave blank for now, or add any upcoming or recommended repairs]

Remember to update the repair history section whenever you have your watches serviced or repaired. This will help you keep track of their condition and maintenance, and potentially increase their value or longevity.
